Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.Controller
      • controllers.UserController

  • @Path(value="/user")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public class UserController
extends Controller
    Controller that manages User

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        @Path(value="v1/{pseudo}")
 @GET
public java.lang.String getUser(@PathParam(value="pseudo")
                                                                   java.lang.String pseudo)
        Gets the user and updates its User.friendList
        Parameters:
        pseudo - the pseudo that identifies the User
        Returns:
        the User
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - 404 if the User can't be found

      • signUp

        @Path(value="v1")
 @PUT
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public java.lang.String signUp(java.lang.String userAsString)
        Inserts a User in database
        Parameters:
        userAsString - the user to put in database
        Returns:
        the created User
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - 409 if the User is already in databse

      • updateUser

        @Path(value="v1")
 @POST
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public java.lang.String updateUser(java.lang.String userAsString)
        Updates given User in database If friends are removed, sends a "friends-removed" event on Pusher Note that this method is a bit heavy and should be used only for the User's profile changes. If you want to update the coordinates of the User, please refer to the updateCoordinates(String) method. Not that calling the updateUser(String) method won't trigger the "position-updated" event on Pusher
        Parameters:
        userAsString - the User to update
        Returns:
        the serialized User
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - 404 if the User can't be found
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - 400 if the given User has a bigger User.friendList, or a same sized one with different friends To manage friends, please use FriendRequestController
        See Also:
        Pusher

      • login

        @Path(value="v1/login")
 @POST
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public java.lang.String login(java.lang.String credentials)
        Connects the user to the application
        Parameters:
        credentials - a json containing a pseudo and a password
        Returns:
        the User if the credentials match one database User
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - 401 if the credentials are wrong
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - 404 if the User doesn't exist in database

      • updateCoordinates

        @Path(value="v1/update-coordinates")
 @POST
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public void updateCoordinates(java.lang.String userAsString)
        Lighter version of POST method, only updating the User User.latitude and User.longitude Triggers a "position-updated" event on Pusher
        Parameters:
        userAsString - the User to update
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - 404 if the User can't be found in database
        See Also:
        Pusher

      • deleteUser

        @Path(value="/v1/{pseudo}")
 @DELETE
public void deleteUser(@PathParam(value="pseudo")
                                                              java.lang.String pseudo)
        Removes a User from database
        Parameters:
        pseudo - the User.pseudo to remove
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - 404 if the User can't be found in database

      • insertTest

        @Path(value="/fixtures")
 @GET
public java.lang.String insertTest()
        Insert false data in database (use only for tests)
        Returns:
        a serialized list of the users
